title: Petroglyph National Monument: Partners
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Partners            Partners       Western National Parks Association Western National Parks Association (WNPA) is a nonprofit education partner of the National Park Service. WNPA supports 67 parks across the West, developing products, services, and programs that enrich the visitor experience.  WNPA supporters understand the core value of national parks. They're a community that believes these special places should be preserved for everyone, for all time.  Become a Member Membership dollars go toward direct aid for partner parks across the West. They also help provide educational materials to park visitors of all ages. You can help preserve the beauty and cultural significance of our parks for future generations by becoming a member of WNPA. Go to wnpa.org or email Petroglyph's park store manager to learn more. As a thank-you, members receive a 15% discount on most Park Store purchases. All purchases help support Petroglyph National Monument and other partner parks.  Â    Management Partner  Petroglyph National Monument is cooperatively managed by the National Park Service and the City of Albuquerque under a Memorandum of Understanding. The City of Albuquerque's Parks and Recreation Open Space Division staffs and maintains Boca Negra Canyon in addition to collecting the parking fees.  Learn more about the City of Albuquerque's Open Space Division.
